intro: Stisseria rugosa, commonly known as the rough-stemmed stisseria, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and often have a slightly serrated edge. Stisseria rugosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
